x10.matrix.comm

Class MatrixBcast

  • x10.matrix.comm.MatrixRemoteCopy
    • x10.matrix.comm.MatrixBcast

  • public class MatrixBcast
extends MatrixRemoteCopy
    This class provides broadcast functions for dense and sparse matrices. The result is defined in DistAarray structure which stores the broadcast data at all places.

    Two implementations are available. One uses MPI routines, and the other is based on X10 remote array copy. To enable MPI communication, add "-define MPI_COMMU -cxx-prearg -DMPI_COMMU" in x10c++ build command, when you include commu package in your application source code, or link to the proper GML library (native_mpi version).

    For more information on how to build different backends and runtime, run command "make help" at the root directory of GML library.

        public static x10.lang.Int bcast(x10.regionarray.DistArray<DenseMatrix> dupmat)
        Declaration: bcast(dupmat:x10.regionarray.DistArray[x10.matrix.DenseMatrix]{self.dist.region.rank==1}): x10.lang.Int.
        Broadcast dense matrix from here to all other places.
This routine is used in sync of DupDenseMatrix
        

        Parameters:
        dmat - Input-output. Distributed storage for the source and copies of dense matrix in all places
        

        Returns:
        count of double-precision data to broadcast

        public static x10.lang.Int bcast(x10.regionarray.DistArray<DenseMatrix> dupmat,
                 x10.lang.Int coloff,

        Declaration: bcast(dupmat:x10.regionarray.DistArray[x10.matrix.DenseMatrix]{self.dist.region.rank==1},coloff:x10.lang.Int,colcnt:x10.lang.Int): x10.lang.Int.
        Broadcast dense matrix from here to all other places.
This routine is used in sync of DupDenseMatrix
        

        Parameters:
        dupmat - Input+output. Distributed storage for dense matrix in all places
        coloff - Input. Offset for the starting column for broadcast
        colcnt - Input. Count of columns to broadcast
        

        Returns:
        Number of elements to broadcast

        This class provides broadcast functions for dense and sparse matrices.
The result is defined in DistAarray structure which stores the broadcast data at all places.


         Two implementations are available. One uses MPI routines,
and the other is based on X10 remote array copy.
To enable MPI communication, add "-define MPI_COMMU -cxx-prearg -DMPI_COMMU"
in x10c++ build command, when you include commu package in your application source
code, or link to the proper GML library (native_mpi version).


        For more information on how to build different backends and runtime,
run command "make help" at the root directory of GML library.
